result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole L Romesburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 75 days jail credit if probation is revoked

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
ADDED 8/14/2014: attorney fees added to JOC payable during period of supervision
No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: 1/12/16 Amended: 613 days credit to be applied at time of sentencing.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. Only use one pharmacy. Notify agent of prescribers.
Any other programming as determined necessary by agent.
Pay supervision fees.
Read the book Unbroken by Laura Hillenbrand. Discussion questions are located within the book. Defendant to write response to each question. One question to be answered per month. Copy sent to agent and the court.

Defendant Nicole L Romesburg in court with attorney Matt E Last.  Defendant in custody. Adam Y Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered. Bail motion addressed by Atty Last. State opposes request. Court denies any modification of bail.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Attorney Last accepts court appointment.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicole L Romesburg in court, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Dejunco appears as friend of the court, and informs is not eligible for public defender and requests court appointed counsel. Affidavit of indigency form completed and reviewed by court.   Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding preliminary hearing. Defendant requests bail reduction. State opposes. Court denies motion to modify bail. Court will appoint counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State by DA Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from Oz Cty Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises the defendant is not sure if retaining private counsel or contacting the public defender.  Counsel waives reading.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $25,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $25,000 cash bail w/conditions:  no alcohol; no controlled subst/prescrip medic; not to operate m/v w/out valid dl.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits to allow defendant time to retain private counsel.  Court orders matter adj to 5/6 at 8:30 am for status of prelim hrg.
